info.title: Atlas REST API
info.description: Atlas exposes a variety of REST endpoints to work with types, entities, lineage and data discovery.

get.description: Retrieve data for the specified attribute search query

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: limit the result set to only include the specified number of entries

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: start offset of the result set (useful for pagination)

parameters.name: typeName
parameters.description: limit the result to only entities of specified type or its sub-types

200.description:
On successful FullText lookup with some results, might return an empty list if execution succeeded
without any results

400.description: Invalid wildcard or query parameters

get.description: Retrieve data for the specified fulltext query

parameters.name: classification
parameters.description: limit the result to only entities tagged with the given classification or or its sub-types

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: limit the result set to only include the specified number of entries

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: start offset of the result set (useful for pagination)

parameters.name: typeName
parameters.description: limit the result to only entities of specified type or its sub-types

200.description:
On successful FullText lookup with some results, might return an empty list if execution succeeded
without any results

400.description: Invalid fulltext or query parameters

post.description: Attribute based search for entities satisfying the search parameters

200.description: On successful search

400.description: Tag/Entity doesn't exist or Tag/entity filter is present without tag/type name

get.description: Retrieve data for the specified DSL

parameters.name: classification
parameters.description: limit the result to only entities tagged with the given classification or or its sub-types

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: limit the result set to only include the specified number of entries

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: start offset of the result set (useful for pagination)

parameters.name: typeName
parameters.description: limit the result to only entities of specified type or its sub-types

200.description:
On successful DSL execution with some results, might return an empty list if execution succeeded
without any results

400.description: Invalid DSL or query parameters

get.description: Retrieve data for the specified fulltext query

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: limit the result set to only include the specified number of entries

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: start offset of the result set (useful for pagination)

200.description:
On successful FullText lookup with some results, might return an empty list if execution succeeded
without any results

400.description: Invalid fulltext or query parameters

get.description: Attribute based search for entities satisfying the search parameters

200.description: On successful search

400.description: Tag/Entity doesn't exist or Tag/entity filter is present without tag/type name

post.description: Attribute based search for entities satisfying the search parameters

200.description: On successful search

400.description: Entity/attribute doesn't exist or entity filter is present without type name

get.description: Relationship search to search for related entities satisfying the search parameters

parameters.name: attributes
parameters.description: set of attributes in search result.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: limit the result set to only include the specified number of entries

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: start offset of the result set (useful for pagination)

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: sort the result using this attribute name, default value is 'name'

200.description: On successful search

400.description: guid is not a valid entity type or attributeName is not a valid relationship attribute

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: User for whom the search is retrieved

200.description: list of all saved searches for given user

get.description: Attribute based search for entities satisfying the search parameters

200.description: Atlas search result

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: User for whom the search is retrieved

post.description:
Create new entity or update existing entity in Atlas.
Existing entity is matched using its unique guid if supplied or by its unique attributes eg: qualifiedName

delete.description: Bulk API to delete list of entities identified by its GUIDs

get.description: Bulk API to retrieve list of entities identified by its GUIDs.

post.description:
Bulk API to create new entities or updates existing entities in Atlas.
Existing entity is matched using its unique guid if supplied or by its unique attributes eg: qualifiedName
Bulk API to associate a tag to multiple entities

get.description:
Bulk API to retrieve list of entities identified by its unique attributes.

In addition to the typeName path parameter, attribute key-value pair(s) can be provided in the following format

typeName=<typeName>&attr_1:<attrName>=<attrValue>&attr_2:<attrName>=<attrValue>&attr_3:<attrName>=<attrValue>

NOTE: The attrName should be an unique attribute for the given entity-type

The REST request would look something like this

GET /v2/entity/bulk/uniqueAttribute/type/hive_db?attr_0:qualifiedName=db1@cl1&attr_2:qualifiedName=db2@cl1

200.description: AtlasEntitiesWithExtInfo

post.description: Upload the file for creating Business Metadata in BULK

200.description: If Business Metadata creation was successful

400.description: If Business Metadata definition has invalid or missing information

409.description: If Business Metadata already exists (duplicate qualifiedName)

get.description: Get the sample Template for uploading/creating bulk BusinessMetaData

400.description: If the provided fileType is not supported

200.description: Template File

delete.description: Delete an entity identified by its GUID.

get.description: Fetch complete definition of an entity given its GUID.

200.description: AtlasEntity

put.description:
Entity Partial Update - Add/Update entity attribute identified by its GUID.
Supports only uprimitive attribute type and entity references.
does not support updation of complex types like arrays, maps
Null updates are not possible

delete.description: Deletes a given classification from an existing entity represented by a guid.

parameters.name: guid
parameters.description: globally unique identifier for the entity

get.description: Gets the list of classifications for a given entity represented by a guid.

parameters.name: guid
parameters.description: globally unique identifier for the entity

200.description: classification for the given entity guid

get.description: Gets the list of classifications for a given entity represented by a guid.

parameters.name: guid
parameters.description: globally unique identifier for the entity

200.description: a list of classifications for the given entity guid

post.description: Adds classifications to an existing entity represented by a guid.

parameters.name: guid
parameters.description: globally unique identifier for the entity

put.description: Updates classifications to an existing entity represented by a guid.

parameters.name: guid
parameters.description: globally unique identifier for the entity

get.description: Get entity header given its GUID.

200.description: AtlasEntity

delete.description: delete given labels to a given entity

post.description: Set labels to a given entity

body.description: - set of labels to be set to the entity

put.description: add given labels to a given entity

delete.description:
Delete an entity identified by its type and unique attributes.

In addition to the typeName path parameter, attribute key-value pair(s) can be provided in the following format

attr:<attrName>=<attrValue>

NOTE: The attrName and attrValue should be unique across entities, eg. qualifiedName

The REST request would look something like this

DELETE /v2/entity/uniqueAttribute/type/aType?attr:aTypeAttribute=someValue

get.description:
Fetch complete definition of an entity given its type and unique attribute.

In addition to the typeName path parameter, attribute key-value pair(s) can be provided in the following format

attr:<attrName>=<attrValue>

NOTE: The attrName and attrValue should be unique across entities, eg. qualifiedName

The REST request would look something like this

GET /v2/entity/uniqueAttribute/type/aType?attr:aTypeAttribute=someValue

200.description: AtlasEntityWithExtInfo

put.description:
Entity Partial Update - Allows a subset of attributes to be updated on
an entity which is identified by its type and unique attribute  eg: Referenceable.qualifiedName.
Null updates are not possible

In addition to the typeName path parameter, attribute key-value pair(s) can be provided in the following format

attr:<attrName>=<attrValue>

NOTE: The attrName and attrValue should be unique across entities, eg. qualifiedName

The REST request would look something like this

PUT /v2/entity/uniqueAttribute/type/aType?attr:aTypeAttribute=someValue

delete.description: Deletes a given classification from an entity identified by its type and unique attributes.

post.description: Adds classification to the entity identified by its type and unique attributes.

put.description: Updates classification on an entity identified by its type and unique attributes.

get.description:
Fetch AtlasEntityHeader given its type and unique attribute.

In addition to the typeName path parameter, attribute key-value pair(s) can be provided in the following format

attr:<attrName>=<attrValue>

NOTE: The attrName and attrValue should be unique across entities, eg. qualifiedName

The REST request would look something like this

GET /v2/entity/uniqueAttribute/type/aType/header?attr:aTypeAttribute=someValue

200.description: AtlasEntityHeader

get.description: Retrieve all glossaries registered with Atlas

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: page size - by default there is no paging

200.description: List of existing glossaries fitting the search criteria or empty list if nothing matches

requestBody.description:
Glossary definition, terms & categories can be anchored to a glossary
using the anchor attribute when creating the Term/Category

200.description: If glossary creation was successful

400.description: If Glossary definition has invalid or missing information

409.description: If Glossary definition already exists (duplicate qualifiedName)

200.description: If BULK glossary category creation was successful

400.description: If ANY Glossary category definition has invalid or missing information

requestBody.description:
glossary category definition, a category must be anchored to a Glossary when creating
Optionally, terms belonging to the category and the hierarchy can also be defined during creation

AtlasAggregationEntry.title: AtlasAggregationEntry
AtlasAggregationEntry.description: An instance of an entity - like hive_table, hive_database.

AtlasAttributeDef.title: AtlasAttributeDef
AtlasAttributeDef.description: class that captures details of a struct-attribute.

AtlasBaseTypeDef.title: AtlasBaseTypeDef
AtlasBaseTypeDef.description: Base class that captures common-attributes for all Atlas types.

AtlasStructDef.title: AtlasStructDef
AtlasStructDef.description: class that captures details of a struct-type.

AtlasClassification.title: AtlasClassification
AtlasClassification.description: An instance of a classification; it doesn't have an identity, this object exists only when associated with an entity.

AtlasClassificationDef.title: AtlasClassificationDef

entityTypes.description:
Specifying a list of entityType names in the classificationDef, ensures that classifications can only be applied to those entityTypes.
  • Any subtypes of the entity types inherit the restriction
  • Any classificationDef subtypes inherit the parents entityTypes restrictions
  • Any classificationDef subtypes can further restrict the parents entityTypes restrictions by specifying a subset of the entityTypes
  • An empty entityTypes list when there are no parent restrictions means there are no restrictions
  • An empty entityTypes list when there are parent restrictions means that the subtype picks up the parents restrictions
  • If a list of entityTypes are supplied, where one inherits from another, this will be rejected. This should encourage cleaner classificationsDefs

AtlasClassificationDef.description: class that captures details of a classification-type.

AtlasRelationshipAttributeDef.title: AtlasRelationshipAttributeDef
AtlasRelationshipAttributeDef.description: class that captures details of a struct-attribute.

AtlasRelationshipDef.title: AtlasRelationshipDef
AtlasRelationshipDef.description:
AtlasRelationshipDef is a TypeDef that defines a relationship.

As with other typeDefs the AtlasRelationshipDef has a name. Once created the RelationshipDef has a guid. The name and the guid are the 2 ways that the RelationshipDef is identified.

RelationshipDefs have 2 ends, each of which specify cardinality, an EntityDef type name and name and optionally whether the end is a container.

RelationshipDefs can have AttributeDefs - though only primitive types are allowed.
RelationshipDefs have a relationshipCategory specifying the UML type of relationship required
RelationshipDefs also have a PropogateTag - indicating which way tags could flow over the relationships.

The way EntityDefs and RelationshipDefs are intended to be used is that EntityDefs will define AttributeDefs these AttributeDefs will not specify an EntityDef type name as their types.

RelationshipDefs introduce new attributes to the entity instances. For example

EntityDef A might have attributes attr1,attr2,attr3
EntityDef B might have attributes attr4,attr5,attr6
RelationshipDef AtoB might define 2 ends 

   end1:  type A, name attr7
   end2:  type B, name attr8

When an instance of EntityDef A is created, it will have attributes attr1,attr2,attr3,attr7
When an instance of EntityDef B is created, it will have attributes attr4,attr5,attr6,attr8

In this way relationshipDefs can be authored separately from entityDefs and can inject relationship attributes into the entity instances

AtlasRelationshipEndDef.title: AtlasRelationshipEndDef
AtlasRelationshipEndDef.description:
The relationshipEndDef represents an end of the relationship. The end of the relationship is defined by a type, an
attribute name, cardinality and whether it  is the container end of the relationship.

AtlasStruct.title: AtlasStruct
AtlasStruct.description: Captures details of struct contents. Not instantiated directly, used only via AtlasEntity, AtlasClassification.

EntityAuditEventV2.title: EntityAuditEventV2
EntityAuditEventV2.description: Structure of v2 entity audit event

Operator.title: Operator
Operator.description:
Supported search operations
Logical comparision operators can only be used with numbers or dates
IN, LIKE, startsWith, endsWith, CONTAINS can only be used with strings or text

PropagateTags.title: PropagateTags
PropagateTags.description:
PropagateTags indicates whether tags should propagate across the relationship instance.

Tags can propagate:

NONE - not at all
ONE_TO_TWO - from end 1 to 2
TWO_TO_ONE - from end 2 to 1
BOTH - both ways

Care needs to be taken when specifying. The use cases we are aware of where this flag is useful:

- propagating confidentiality classifications from a table to columns - ONE_TO_TWO could be used here
- propagating classifications around Glossary synonyms - BOTH could be used here.

There is an expectation that further enhancements will allow more granular control of tag propagation and will address how to resolve conflicts.

RelationshipCategory.title: RelationshipCategory
RelationshipCategory.description:
The Relationship category determines the style of relationship around containment and lifecycle. UML terminology is used for the values.

ASSOCIATION is a relationship with no containment.
COMPOSITION and AGGREGATION are containment relationships.

The difference being in the lifecycles of the container and its children. In the COMPOSITION case, the children cannot exist without the container. For AGGREGATION, the life cycles of the container and children are totally independant.

SearchFilter.title: SearchFilter
SearchFilter.description: Generic filter, to specify search criteria using name/value pairs.

attributes.description: Attribute values included in the results

SortType.title: SortType
SortType.description: to specify whether the result should be sorted? If yes, whether asc or desc.

Status.title: Status
Status.description: Status of the entity - can be active or deleted. Deleted entities are not removed from Atlas store.
